Content: Cf rpc is a good place to start. <https://github.com/Arkensor/DayZ-CommunityFramework/blob/production/docs/RPC/index.md>

Author: kpro1982
Content: CF RPC is a little different from vanilla. But reliable and easy to use. There are a couple of things to keep in mind. (1) An RPC is a one way communication from source  to target. An RPC has two parts.  A `sendRpc` instruction that runs on the source (e.g. the server) and the main method which runs on the target (e.g. client) (or the other way around).  (2) If communications need to go both ways then you need two RPC.  (3) you pass data through an RPC with the Param<> template. Param1<string> to pass one variable, Param1<string,int> to pass to variables, and so on.  Finally, RPC themselves are super simple. If your RPC doesn't work its almost always because you have a typo in one of your method signatures.
